explains: n. 凝聚力，团结；内聚力；（句子、文章等在语法或含义方面的）连贯，衔接
wordGroup: cohesion force 内聚力，抱合力

sentences.en: By 1990, it was clear that the cohesion of the armed forces was rapidly breaking down.
sentences.cn: 到1990年时，武装部队凝聚力明显地迅速瓦解。

sentences.en: The source of Roman obsession with unity and cohesion may well have lain in the pattern of Rome's early development.
sentences.cn: 罗马人执着于团结和凝聚力很可能起源于罗马的早期发展模式。

sentences.en: However, this approach does not include investment in new infrastructure, nor does it guarantee better regional cohesion.
sentences.cn: 然而，这种方法不包括对新基础设施的投资，也不能保证更好的地区凝聚力。
